intro: Fridericia pearcei, commonly known as the Mexican frostflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, woolly leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Fridericia pearcei is noted for its unique frost-covered appearance during winter, which gives it its common name.
